intro: Oligochaetochilus concavus, commonly known as the concave-stemmed moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, creeping growth habit and its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. The plant features elongated, narrow leaves that are often curved or twisted, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is typically found in temperate regions, growing on soil or rock surfaces. Oligochaetochilus concavus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecosystem.
